author: Rafaela Senatore, com supervis√£o da reda√ß√£o
title: Quando Wembanyama vai voltar a jogar?
text:
Victor Wembanyama, jogador do San Antonio Spurs, da NBA, teve que ser afastado das quadras por um caso de trombose grave, que afetou o bra√ßo direito do atleta. O franc√™s quase n√£o teve descanso na Inter temporada, em junho de 2024, mas ele terminou como n√∫mero 1 no draft, com dois jogos na Liga de Ver√£o da NBA.
LEIA MAIS
Copa do Brasil: onde ser√° √Åguia X Fluminense?
Quando Wembanyama vai voltar a jogar?
Victor Wembanyama deve ficar fora do restante da temporada da NBA. O franc√™s teve uma trombose venosa profunda no ombro direito e vai desfalcar o San Antonio Spurs. Em comunicado, o time texano afirmou que o diagn√≥stico da doen√ßa foi descoberto depois do All-Star Game em S√£o Francisco, no fim de semana passado.
Na quarta-feira (19), Wembanyama entrou na lista de d√∫vidas dos Spurs para o jogo com o Phoenix Suns em Austin, nesta quinta (20), o time texano mudou de sede para dois jogos. O comunicado do San Antonio informava que o franc√™s estava doente, mas n√£o detalhava a situa√ß√£o m√©dica do jogador.
Wembanyama esteve presente em 46 jogos dos Spurs, sendo titular em todos. Tem m√©dia de 24,3 pontos e 11 rebotes nesta temporada. Vice-campe√£o ol√≠mpico com a Fran√ßa, ele foi eleito o calouro do ano na √∫ltima temporada da NBA.
LEIA TAMB√âM
O que Hamilton disse sobre o carro da Ferrari?

author: The Canadian Press
title: Warmth returns to B.C. the week, not so fast on the Prairies
text: A warming trend is in the forecast for much of British Columbia after several days of record-breaking temperatures, but the cold weather on the Prairies will continue. Environment Canada says temperatures are rising but snow flurries are in the forecast for the Metro Vancouver area, followed by rain later this week and temperatures well above zero degrees Celsius. Temperatures in Alberta are forecast to start to moderate today and through the week, but it will remain cold. Calgary and Edmonton have been experiencing wind chills as high as -50 C over the weekend, but Environment Canada says the daily low temperatures will drop to -21 C. Environment Canada says despite the somewhat warmer temperatures in Alberta, frostbite warnings will remain in effect. B.C.‚Äôs public power utility, BC Hydro, says the extreme cold drove peak hourly electricity demand across the province to a record high on Friday night, reaching 11,300 megawatts. READ ALSO: [Winter weather still gripping Canada, but some B.C. warnings being dropped](https://www.vancouverislandfreedaily.com/news/winter-weather-still-gripping-canada-but-some-bc-warnings-being-dropped-7296631)

author: Yanira Mart√≠n
title: La tasa de infecciones respiratorias disminuye en Canarias
text: La tasa de infecciones respiratorias disminuye en Canarias La incidencia de afecciones como la gripe, el covid y el virus respiratorio sincitial baja 75,37 puntos en una semana La incidencia de las infecciones respiratorias agudas en [Canarias](https://www.eldia.es/canarias/) (IRAs) volvi√≥ a experimentar un descenso en el transcurso de la pasada semana. Seg√∫n la √∫ltima actualizaci√≥n del informe que elabora la Direcci√≥n General de Salud P√∫blica del [Servicio Canario de la Salud](https://www.eldia.es/tags/servicio-canario-de-salud/) (SCS), la tasa de contagios de estas afecciones se situ√≥ en 573,96 casos por cada 100.000 habitantes entre el 28 de octubre y el 3 de noviembre, lo que se traduce en 75,37 puntos menos que la semana anterior y en 94,66 puntos menos que en el balance realizado entre los d√≠as 14 y 20 de octubre. Con base en el mismo documento, la incidencia de las IRAs ha descendido en todos los grupos de edad. Ahora bien, el colectivo m√°s afectado contin√∫a siendo el que conforman los beb√©s y los ni√±os de 0 a 4 a√±os, con un total de 3.568 cuadros por cada 100.000 -356 puntos menos que la semana previa-. Algo menos notable fue la reducci√≥n que reflej√≥ el par√°metro del s√≠ndrome gripal, que alcanz√≥ los 30,23 casos por cada 100.000 personas -solo 0,99 puntos menos-, si bien el del Covid-19 registr√≥ un descenso mayor y se redujo a 2,99 cuadros sobre el mismo c√≥mputo poblacional -2,23 puntos menos-. La tasa de hospitalizaci√≥n por infecciones graves tambi√©n registr√≥ variaciones. De hecho, la incidencia qued√≥ cifrada en 7,5 casos por cada 100.000 habitantes -1,1 puntos menos que la semana anterior-. Los pacientes mayores de 79 a√±os son los m√°s afectados, con una tasa de 36,1 cuadros por cada 100.000, cinco puntos m√°s que en el informe precedente. Desde el inicio de la temporada se han analizado 46 muestras centinela de infecciones graves para hallar la presencia del SARS-CoV-2 y 43 para detectar la gripe y el virus respiratorio sincitial (VRS). Los resultados han anotado un 4,35% de cuadros positivos en el caso del primero y un 2,33% en el del VRS. El dato de la gripe, en cambio, refleja un 0%. Asimismo, se han detectado 16 muestras positivas para otros virus respiratorios: una en adenovirus, ocho en enterovirus, una en parainfluenza tipo 1, dos en parainfluenza tipo 2, una en parainfluenza tipo 3 y tres en rinovirus. Al listado se suman cuatro muestras positivas en bacterias. En concreto, una en Bordetella parapertussis y tres en Streptococcus pneumoniae. Urgencias Seg√∫n informaron este jueves desde los cuatro grandes hospitales de Canarias ‚ÄìInsular-Materno, Negr√≠n, Universitario de Canarias y La Candelaria- los servicios de Urgencias siguen funcionando con normalidad y la afluencia diaria de pacientes entra dentro de la media habitual de cada centro. Por tanto, en estos espacios asistenciales a√∫n no ha impactado la circulaci√≥n de las afecciones respiratorias. Hay que recordar que la campa√±a de vacunaci√≥n contra la gripe y el Covid-19 arranc√≥ en los centros de salud de las Islas el pasado 15 de octubre. La Direcci√≥n General de Salud P√∫blica recuerda la importancia de que la poblaci√≥n diana acceda a estas profilaxis. author: MENAFN
title: Karnataka: Siddaramaiah Govt's Temple Tax Bill Defeated BJP Chants 'Jai Shree Ram' To Protest. 10 Things To Know | MENAFN.COM
text: The Congress that brought the Hindu Religious Endowment Amendment Bill in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly could not pass the bill despite a 10-minute adjournment due to the lack of strength of the government in the State's Council opposition expressed great displeasure against the Religious Endowment Amendment Bill Minister Ramalinga Reddy bowed to the opposition's pressure and said that he will present the bill again on Monday. But Deputy Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Pranesh had objected to this. The Deputy Speaker said that once a bill has been discussed, it cannot be postponed proceedings were adjourned for 10 minutes to discuss and decide the proceedings resumed, the Congress inevitably put the Religious Endowment Bill to a vote. A large number of BJP and opposition members participated. Only five members of the ruling party were present MLAs voted against the bill in the Assembly. Thus, the bill could not be passed the bill fell, BJP members raised 'Jai Shree Ram' slogans while Congress members shouted 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'.Meanwhile, after criticisms regarding the Karnataka government's amendments to the Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowment Bill, ministers Ramalinga Reddy and Dinesh Gundu Rao came in defence of the decision while criticising the opposition, BJP for Transport, Ramalinga Reddy alleged that BJP is 'anti-Hindu' adding that the party which was in power in 2011 had made the amendments to the Bill for Health, Dinesh Gundu Rao said that the BJP should realise the Bill is for the benefit of the temples Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said that the allegations regarding the amendments to the Bill \"appear to be misrepresented\", \"aiming only at misleading the public\" and \"polarizing people along communal lines for political leverage.\"The Bill mandates the state to collect 10 per cent tax from temples generating revenue exceeding ‚Çπ1 crore and 5 per cent from shrines with revenue of between ‚Çπ10 lakh and ‚Çπ1 crore. MENAFN23022024007365015876ID1107892938 Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information ‚Äúas is‚Äù without warranty of any kind. We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy, content, images, videos, licenses, completeness, legality, or reliability of the information contained in this article. author: @TheDailyGuardian
title: PM Modi recalls profound sacrifices of Jesus Christ on Good Friday
text:
[+](javascipt:void(0);)
Prime Minister Narendra Modi reflected on the significance of Good Friday, highlighting its message of compassion and forgiveness. He took to social media, stating, ‚ÄúToday, on Good Friday, we remember the profound sacrifice of Jesus Christ. May everyone find strength in the lessons of compassion and forgiveness it teaches us.‚Äù
Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also extended Good Friday wishes, emphasizing the values of sacrifice, love, compassion, forgiveness, and unity. He expressed, ‚ÄúOn the auspicious occasion of Good Friday, let‚Äôs remember the supreme sacrifice and love that guide us towards compassion, love, forgiveness, and unity. May this Good Friday be a time of reflection, renewal, and grace for all.‚Äù
West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee joined in wishing the Christian community, saying, ‚ÄúWishing all my Christian Brothers & Sisters a graceful & blessed Good Friday. May this Holy Day of Penance, Prayers, and Sacrifice inspire us all to live a life of compassion, love, and peace.‚Äù
Congress National President Mallikarjun Kharge urged people to embrace the spirit of humanity, kindness, and peace on Good Friday. He expressed, ‚ÄúWishing you all a blessed #GoodFriday. May the spirit of compassion, forgiveness, sacrifice, and empathy keep guiding our path. Let us imbibe the spirit of humanity, kindness, and peace amongst us.‚Äù
Good Friday was commemorated with prayers and processions across the country, depicting the stations of the cross. In Thiruvananthapuram, devotees participated in a procession to Saint Joseph‚Äôs Cathedral in Palayam, attended by Member of Parliament for Thiruvananthapuram, Shashi Tharoor. Devotees also offered prayers in the national capital on this solemn occasion.
Good Friday, a Christian holiday, marks the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ at Calvary. It is the start of the Easter weekend.

author: EIN News
title: Shapiro Administration Celebrates Recipients of 2025 Governor's Awards for Local Government Excellence - Golf News Today - EIN Presswire
text:
Shapiro Administration Celebrates Recipients of 2025 Governor‚Äôs Awards for Local Government Excellence 19 total officials and local governments were recognized for serving their communities.
The City of Scranton was also awarded with the 2024 ‚ÄòSecretary‚Äôs Award for Municipal Excellence‚Äô from DCED.
Harrisburg, PA ‚Äì Today, on behalf of Governor Josh Shapiro and Lieutenant Governor Austin Davis, Department of Community and Economic Development (DCED) Secretary Rick Siger recognized Pennsylvania municipalities and local government officials for their dedication to strengthening their communities and better serving their residents during the 29th Annual Governor‚Äôs Awards for Local Government Excellence.
In total, three counties, six municipalities, one organization, and nine individuals from across the Commonwealth were recognized at today‚Äôs ceremony for excellent service.
‚ÄúThe individuals, municipalities, counties, and organizations that we are honoring today work passionately to ‚Äúget stuff done‚Äù by improving public services and making their communities better, said Governor Josh Shapiro. Their collective work has made a difference in the health, safety and quality of life of families and individuals across Pennsylvania. They are committed to making our Commonwealth a place where everyone can live, work, and thrive, and we are proud to recognize them for their dedication and excellence.‚Äù
The annual awards ceremony coincides with Pennsylvania Local Government Day, which focuses attention on the need for strong, independent, and active local government in the Commonwealth and celebrates the valuable contributions made by residents serving their communities.
‚ÄúIn this moment ‚Äì when it feels like the very concept of public service is under attack ‚Äì it‚Äôs important to celebrate the dedicated individuals who are working, day in and day out, at the local level to make Pennsylvania‚Äôs communities safer, healthier and more vibrant,‚Äù said Lt. Gov. Austin Davis. ‚ÄúThe Shapiro-Davis Administration salutes this year‚Äôs award recipients and thanks them for ‚Äògetting stuff done‚Äô for the good people of Pennsylvania.‚Äù
DCED‚Äôs Governor‚Äôs Center for Local Government Services sponsors Local Government Day annually to honor local governments and officials who serve their communities and improve their quality of life.
Detailed information about this year‚Äôs recipients can be found on DCED‚Äôs website .
The following local government officials were recognized:
Dennis R. Arthur, Sr., Commissioner, Tinicum Township ‚Äì Delaware County Tammy Firda , Council Member, Lincoln Borough, and President, Steel Rivers COG ‚Äì Allegheny County Steven D. Hess , Sr., Supervisor, North Centre Township ‚Äì Columbia County Judith Kording , Assistant Manager, Shaler Township ‚Äì Allegheny County Centrice Martin , Manager, Ferguson Township ‚Äì Centre County Zachary Norwood , Planning Director ‚Äì Crawford County William Ross , Administrator, Lower Saucon Authority ‚Äì Northampton County Diane Schaefer , Borough Manager, Youngwood Township ‚Äì Westmoreland County Lori Vargo Haffner , County Commissioner ‚Äì Northampton County The following counties, municipalities, and organizations were recognized:
Building Community Partnerships
Wright Township ‚Äì Luzerne County Fiscal Accountability and Best Management Practices
City of Lancaster Home Rule Study Commission ‚Äì Lancaster County Fiscal Accountability and Best Management Practices
Local Government Academy ‚Äì Allegheny County Health and Wellness Initiatives
Indiana County Office of Planning and Development ‚Äì Indiana County Innovative Community/Governmental Initiatives
Milton Borough ‚Äì Northumberland County Innovative Planning and Sound Land Use Practices
City of Saint Marys ‚Äì Elk County Intergovernmental Cooperation
Westmoreland County Department of Planning and Development ‚Äì Westmoreland County Promoting Community/Economic Revitalization
Pocono Township ‚Äì Monroe County Responding to Adversity
Tioga County ‚Äì Tioga County Technology Advancements
Borough of Donora ‚Äì Washington County In addition to the annual awards, the City of Scranton was also presented with the 2024 DCED ‚ÄòSecretary‚Äôs Award for Municipal Excellence.‚Äô The City has distinguished itself through a concerted effort to enhance quality of life by cultivating community partnerships, by achieving an investment-grade credit rating, cutting red tape to encourage business development and entrepreneurship, and investing over $5 million in small business programs to boost wages and retain talent. Representatives of the City of Scranton on hand to receive the award are pictured in the photo above on the right.
‚ÄúScranton‚Äôs forward momentum perfectly illustrates the spirit of this award ‚Äì highlighting municipalities where everyone works together to help the place that they call home reach its full potential,‚Äù said DCED Secretary Rick Siger. ‚ÄúThe Shapiro Administration knows that creating a vibrant community goes hand-in-hand with economic growth and is thrilled to recognize Scranton for all the hard work it has done in both areas to position itself for a brighter future.‚Äù
The ‚ÄòSecretary‚Äôs Award for Municipal Excellence‚Äô, which highlights Governor Josh Shapiro‚Äôs focus on strengthening communities across Pennsylvania to spur the economy, is presented to municipalities where local leaders have demonstrated a commitment to creating dynamic change for residents, businesses, innovators, and entrepreneurs.
For more information about Local Government Day, visit the DCED website , and be sure to stay up-to-date with all of our agency news on Facebook , X , and LinkedIn .
MEDIA CONTACT:
Governor‚Äôs Office, ra-gvgovpress@pa.gov , 717.783.1116
DCED, dcedpress@pa.gov
# # #

author: Vaughn Larson
title: Wisconsin Army Guard sends Soldier to national Best Warrior Competition [Image 2 of 4]
text:
Staff Sgt. Alexander Kilbane, from the Wisconsin Army National Guard‚Äôs Headquarters Detachment, 2nd Battalion, 426th Regional Training Institute, reassembles an M2 50-cal crew-served weapon May 4 during the 2024 Region IV Best Warrior Competition at Camp Dodge, Iowa. Kilbane‚Äôs fellow competitor, Spc. Tevin Kenton of the 105th Cavalry Regiment, took first place in the lower enlisted division and will represent Wisconsin at the national Best Warrior Competition this August in Vermont. 135th Mobile Public Affairs Detachment photo
